intro: Campylostemon duchesnei, commonly known as the Dusky Mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, broad leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Campylostemon duchesnei is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
